reviews.review_text: Excellent food- lots of different flavours. A great example of a tasting menu done very well. Wine pairings also good and varied (all Canadian wines). Servers were excellent but we did feel a bit rushed which took the edge off an otherwise excellent meal.

Had a wonderful 1st time at the Mackenzie Room on my birthday. As expected, each dish was phenomenal and high quality, all well developed with great flavors.  The staff were incredibly kind and lovely, and I really appreciated how much of an effort they put in to create a cozy dining experience. I sat at the bar and was well attended to, bartender & server all very warm and friendly. They consider the little things in both the service and food. Highly recommended and added to my favorite food list for a revisit.

First off, Patrick was an amazing bartender and host for us sitting at the bar. As it was my birthday the staff gave me a signed card and went out of the way to make the dinning experience world class. From unique shared menu for two that I highly recommended to cocktails that will knock your socks off. The McKenzie should be high on your list of restaurants to try in Vancouver and is 100% worthy of their first star. -Max

The Mackenzie Room has been on my list for a very long time. Im so glad to have finally been able to check it out. The food was absolutely delicious and the service was unreal. We sat at the bar where Lewis was extremely friendly and helpful. We will be back soon!

Dined solo to kick off my last week in Vancouver on this trip. Focusing on locally sourced ingredients, the solo menu is comprised 5 courses. At only $74, it s an incredible value. The menu has pun names which I absolutely adored; Sashimi Not, Zucc I am Your Father, Trout Krout Sprout, of Bison Men, and Le Big Mack. My favourite bites were the zucchini two ways, the trout (minus the brussels) and the King Salmon sashimi. The bison was very well cooked and the spinach was delicious but the potato was lacklustre. Along with the meal, the bar manager made me a beverage pairing which had cocktails and glasses of wine based on my preference. The final digestif had pickled spruce tips stuffed in an olive. There were a number of other dishes on the menu which caught my eye. I definitely will have to come back the next time I am in town.

WOW. Location is a bit sketchy to say the least.....notwithstanding, the minute you enter youre welcomed by passionate and knowledgeable staff. If you are a foodie this is a MUST TRY location. Best option is the, I WANT IT ALL option ($85/person). Its a 12 course tapas share option, of delicious pallet popping delights, where you get to try the entire Chefs Creations. Only catch is you need a minimum of 4 people to try this. So get your double date on and try this place. Youll thank me later.  CHEERS!!! PS- There is also a very creative signature cocktails menu if you so desire.

The food was superb. We came away reminiscing about several of the dishes and wishing we had more. The service was very friendly and prompt. Everything we could ask for in service. The only gripe I had, and it is indeed a small one is that the restaurant was way too dark. Walking out to the street after dinner we were dazzled by the brightness of the Vancouver lampposts.

Food quality is amazing. One of the best restaurants in Vancouver. Service is spectacular with such attention to detail. And the cocktail menu is also very thought out and delicious. Will be back again and again!

This local restaurant is one of my favourites in Vancouver. I haven t come across another restaurant that has consistently delicious food. Their  I want it all  menu is reasonably priced at $85 for 12 courses and all reasonably portioned that you d be full by the end of the meal. The service is excellent and the vibe is quite lively. The only thing I d note is that I d like the lights a tad brighter. If you are coming by vehicle you can come down Powell street after a left turn from Knight street. Park in front or on the next block, at $1 per hour. Definitely a must try if you are a local or visiting Vancouver for your first time. Make sure to book your reservations in advance (1 mth). Of all the courses I really liked the  chicken of the sea ,  Hal 9000 ,  lamb tartare ,  Pigs in a blanket , and  Rhubarbra streisand .

Absolutely delicious food and great service! Each dish was beautifully decorated, accompanied by delicious sauce. Chicken of the sea is a must eat. Lamb tartare was not smelly at all, flavoured with lemon and capers. Trout was fluffy and seasoned well. Quite pricey for the portion but recommend this place to everyone for quality food.

Amazing service and great food inside a very unassuming exterior. The Mackenzie Room somehow manage to land a very interesting vibe that feels very welcoming and casual all the while delivering a great fine dining experience. Would definitely come back!

Had an amazing dinner last night with my partner, celebrating my birthday,  the food and service was impeccable. Already cant wait go back. Thanks again to our server and the sommelier for the wonderful recommendations.

I came in for Dine out this past Sunday and was impressed. We sat at the bar and our server gave us great service. The food was delicious in my opinion. The stand out dishes were the chicken of the sea and the pork dish. I also ordered a non alcoholic ginger beer for $5 which I thought was a great price for the taste . Overall I thought for the food and service, the price we paid was fair. I would definitely come back with 4 people to try the full tasting menu. Areas for improvement would be check the chairs/stools to make sure theyre level as mine was wobbly. Not a huge thing but its a small fix that I think would improve the experience. Also I would recommend Ubering as the area is unfortunately very sketchy. If you are going to walk, Id recommend parking in the neighborhood with houses more south and then walking.
Everything was just perfect!  I WANT IT ALL  course menu is a must!!! Perfectly balanced and organized  All the servers were well-mannered and foods were outstanding.

Fabulous food, tastes better than The Published. Good ambience and wait staff were professional, courteous and welcoming. Dessert could be a little bit better. The flan was a bit too sweet and dense. Great overall experience and would rate the restaurant as a solid 9/10 or 4.5 out of 5.
Superb food, great service. A must do experience when in Vancouver. Slightly sketchy neighbourhood adds to the vibe.

Everything was wonderful. Diego was great. Four of us did the all the way menu and the standout dishes were the Sea urchin pate with squid ink bread.l chicken of the sea, the squid pasta carbonara squid games, and the notorious PIG. The pork jowl was good enough to convince our Muslim friend who doesnt eat pork to try it and he loved it! The wine options were good and the cocktails were excellent. No complaints. I will definitely be back.

We went there as a group of 4 and tried the tasting menu. It was delicious with a preference for the fish/squid. The only downside was that we couldnt hear pretty well the description of the food by the different waiters but everything was listed on a black board on the wall. Bonus point for the creativity in naming the title of each meal.

Probably the best food I ve ever gotten from a restaurant. It s too bad they don t have bread service as I would have cleaned the plate. Highly recommend checking this place out! From the unique/fun vibe inside to excellent service to amazing food, you can t go wrong. Note about the location: it looks super sketch everywhere around the restaurant but don t let that deter you. There is pay parking right in front of the restaurant.

Our top favorite restaurant in Vancouver. It was such a great experience, from service to food. Thank you, guys! We had their tasting set with wine pairing, which I highly recommend. The food is so perfectly balanced, delicious! And our server was giving some introduction to every single course, she was amazing. This place is a real hidden gem.

Incredible food! Culinary artistry served up in East Van. The chef s menu has everything. I found it to be filling. (For the guys, not quite.) the space was cozy, very cozy. The decor, furniture and lighting made it feel antique, like a community of old friends. Similarly, the service was also chummy, like we knew each other and could joke around casually. They also knew their staff, introducing each plate perfectly. The space and washrooms were clean. Some things to know before you go. The area is not upscale, downtown Van. I wouldn t walk from my car to the restaurant in the dark by myself. (Maybe that s just me.) The building is old. I noticed that my table was on a slight slant. If you re with vegan friends, the restaurant will accommodate, which is amazing and not too common. And make reservations, if you can!

We came to the restaurant on the recommendation of a colleague, and what a delightful discovery it was ! The ambiance and restaurant design are very pleasant. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted by a charming staff, and our server even made the effort to address us in French, which truly added a special touch to our experience. However, the real star of the evening was the food. The dishes were simply exceptional, and it was evident that a lot of effort went into crafting the flavors and presentation. Every bite was a burst of flavors, and we were pleasantly surprised by the creativity of the dishes. Personally, Im not a big fan of desserts, but the plum choux with pistachio cream was simply divine. It was the perfect sweet touch to conclude this memorable feast. In summary, I wholeheartedly recommend this place. The restaurant offers an exceptional culinary experience, a pleasant atmosphere, and attentive service. If youre looking for a memorable gastronomic experience, look no further. This is a must-visit address.

Lots of interesting, well-balanced flavours. Most offerings seem to have a rich and heavier focus (protein or a vegetable) paired with pops of acid in sauces or pickles. Each bite can vary so it never gets boring. Dishes are meant to be shared. Servers were very attentive and friendly. It sounds like the menu is updated frequently, so I look forward to coming back again. Parking: Paid street parking along the road next to the restaurant and across the street.

Everything was spectacular. I would definitely revisit. Servers were extremely attentive and knowledgeable. Chicken of the Sea dish is by far the best pate dish Ive had in Vancouver. Highly recommend.
Seafood forward, chef driven, locally sourced, New Canadian in a rustic, casual Gastown dining room. Outstanding service. Tasting menus or  a la carte ordering available.

We went for the 2023 dine out menu, which was made up of 5 dishes from their regular menu. The food and service was great and the restaurant had a good energy. The location is in Vancouver s old Japantown, right across from Oppenheimer park, which at night isn t the best place to walk around, but the building has a ton of character and it is a nice hidden gem. The chef is creative and puts some bold flavours on the plate. Examples include a sea urchin pate with a hazelnut spread and charred onions to be scooped up with torn squid ink bread. Or, a  cabbage roll  with cabbage, pork, pork belly, and sweet breads on top of pomme puree. The cocktails were also delicious and they include some great local beers. Next up is the  I ll have it all , a menu for a table of 4 that includes all of their dishes.

I loved Diego! Such a lovely server. So attentive and friendly. Great style too. Making sure I felt super special on my birthday. The food was so delicious. I had an amazing time at Mackenzie Room. Order the chicken of sea:)
We tried the just for two of us  menu . We love it . The server explained every dish well .Recommended .

I love this restaurant. We ve been a few times before, often for special occasions. My 10yr old wanted to try sea urchin, well you can t go wrong with Chicken of the Sea! Once again food was amazing, service is perfect. Bartender made my son some custom drinks that were delicious and made him feel welcome in a fine dining restaurant. Great restaurant for special occasions and family night out. We went at 5:30pm, there was Indigenous drumming and dancing in the park, great chance to see that part of the community.

Went here for dinner and was blown away by how original and delicious every dish was. We were originally just going to order a few dishes stand-alone but our waiter convinced us to get the  I Want It All . This was a great decision. It let us try a lot of dishes we weren t originally considering. The  Chicken of the Sea ,  Hello Clarice , and  Sir Salmon Rushdie  were personal favorites. If you are in the Vancouver area this is a can t miss spot if you want to experience some fantastic food.

We enjoyed everything about this restaurant. Having spent a long time reviewing the choices and trying to figure out what to order, I got some very sound advice from one of their regulars. A young couple sitting a table over from us -- Everythings good! And so started our journey munching through the entire menu. Or rather as much as we could manage. My advice: Order one of each, to share with your company and whatever you dont get to try on the first visit, pick up on the next trip.

This is our new favourite restaurant in Vancouver! We came here to celebrate my husbands birthday and we were blown away by both the food and service. Every course was delicious and all the flavours paired so well together. Our server Diego was very personable, knowledgeable about each dish and drink, and made us feel right at home. We will definitely be back!

Been to so many great restaurants in Vancouver. Among the fierce competition and demanding customers, this place is a great one! I would come back just for the dish  Chicken  of the Sea - sea urchin hazelnut pate with squid ink brioche. Unpretentious decor, consistent high quality dishes, and great service. Highly recommended!

Been here several times and still think the Chicken of the Sea is bomb. Its so good we usually order it twice (once as an appie and second time for dessert). The jungle juice was nice to share with  friend and served in a beautiful crystal bowl. Both the pork and duck were cooked to perfection--tender and melt-in-your-mouth. Lamb tartare--yum! We leave happy each and every time we come. Its one of our favourite restaurants in the city. Highly recommend.

Came here for dineout and it was an amazing experience. The dishes were all amazing and unique, and the drinks were delicious. My personal favorite has got to be the chicken of the sea. The pate along with the ink brioche were an amazing pairing. I also loved the salmon dish. The fish just melts in your mouth and the miso butter is super tasty

One of my favourite restaurants in Vancouver. The food is always amazing and has so many unique or well crafted flavours. Been here multiple times and I always get the pre made menu. The chicken of the sea is a must but everything is good. They do fish really well and I think I may have had the most tender duck of my life! Great date spot. Funny how many good restaurants are in a sketchy part of town!

Tried their tasting menu for 6 people. They served 2 of everything except the duck which we had to order on our own on the side. The duck was probably the best thing I had all night followed by the salmon.

Very creative and excellently cooked food. We had (see chalkboard picture): 1. Wesley Snips: 8/10 2. Hello Clarice: 9.5/10 (even my mum liked lamb tartare!) 3. Sir Salman Rushdie: 9/10 4. SurfnSurf: 9/10 The service was very slow. My orders for wine and cocktails arrived after each course they were destined for, despite me ordering each one a course or so in advance. The bill had two items overcharged that I had to quibble about. The noise level was unbearable and we had to leave, otherwise I would have ordered more food and dessert and booze. Quite hipster. I probably made a mistake bringing my 78 year old Punjabi mum here.

Certainly one of the most unique meals weve had. We selected the Just The Two of Us menu with wine pairings. The first item, known as Chicken of the Sea was an extraordinary flavour bomb.  Sea urchin pate and squid ink brioche might be uncommon but they are part of a signature dish here that should not be missed. Next came a salad with uncommon radish varieties, pear chunks and lardo. Slow roasted salmon with miso beurre blanc and nori oil was so good, it will change the way I cook this fish at home. Duck breast met the same high standards but our Gods Flan dessert, while attractive, was less satisfying. People may hesitate to visit a restaurant in Vancouvers Powell Street neighbourhood but I am not aware of any problems experienced by diners during years of operation. Scout Magazine rates this as one of Vancouvers best 25 restaurants and were already planning to return with another couple to enjoy the I Want it All menu.

The Mackenzie Room has just shot up into our top favorite restaurants of all the time. We experienced their 5 course tasting menu. Each course was plated beautifully, and cooked to perfection with complex yet balanced flavours. Our tasting adventure kicked off with a unique sea urchin pate on squid brioche in Chicken of the Sea. The Big Tuna was an elevated home style dish. The Duck Ganoush was perfectly cooked. The atmosphere is rustic and intimate, great for small group gatherings. The service was exceptional with frequent check-in from the waiters between dishes. Cannot wait to return for another visit!

We went for the dine out Vancouver menu specifically. It was delicious and did not disappoint. I am always in love and impressed by a chef that can use cheaper and readily available ingredients to anyone and elevate a dish, especially in a five course tasting menu. Loved the atmosphere and the feeling it gave off. The only thing I would say is, it was a little dark in the room. I understand what they were trying to achieve, but could use a little more light in the room to be able to see the gorgeous food they put in front of me.

Celebrated my birthday and it was lovely. Chicken of the Sea is to die for. That squid ink brioche is so incredibly delicious. Definitely our favourite dish from the tasting menu for 2. The Arctic Char came in as a close second because of its crispy skin goodness. I think TMR might just become one of our regular dinner spots

One of the best meals we have had this year. We had everything on the menu. I thought $89/person for 12 dishes was reasonable. Service was spot on and food was enjoyable. Lots of flavors and every dish was different. Would definitely come back when the menu changes.

Amazing meal. Great service. All the meats were cooked brilliantly and the blends of flavors and ingredients were novel, sometimes striking, but always pleasing. The highlight for me was the Salmon Rushdie.

The best option is to go in at least group of 4 and get the  I want it all  - the food portions are generous and the drinks were delicious. Highly recommend trying this place at least once! Went back again for NYE dinner and it did not disappoint. The staff were super friendly and accommodating. And as always, the food was delicious!

This place was highly enjoyable. We arrived 30 minutes early, and we were able to be accommodated immediately. Each menu item we ordered exhibited such delicate techniques, and presented well. The wait staff took the time to explain the concept of each dish. Although, I wish a nice steak dish would be on the menu, the duck we ordered was an amazing surprise.

Another amazing restaurant under the Collective Hospitality Group. Their restaurants are amazing and The Mackenzie Room is no different. Rustic meets refined is the theme. Service staff friendly and knowledgeable of the dishes being served. We also ran behind and they were so good to still accommodate us without any attitude like some other restaurants would do. Each dish prepared to perfection. The #beefbaby left me wanting more and more. I m not major on sea urchin but their Chicken of the Sea was also phenomenal and paired beautifully with the squid ink brioche. The sear on the Arctic char was perfection and the Pork collar (in Collar by Your Name) was beyond tender. Loved the orange panna cotta which wasn t overly sweet and paired nicely with the citrus of the orange. Would highly recommend this restaurant and it s a definite  yes  for me .

Amazing service and unforgettable food! Our servers had impeccable knowledge of each dish s preparation and ingredients. The ingredients were all fresh, and they were used in creative combinations such as the squid ink brioche with sea urchin pate, pickled pear, hazelnut, and burnt onion. Overall, an excellent dining experience with an exciting tasting menu!

What a unique and delicious experience! Loved everything about The Mackenzie Room-setting, vibe, food, drinks, service all top notch. We had the tasting menu for two with wine pairings. Great decision. This is a gem.

Oh Jesus! What an amazing set of food!! We went as a party of four and had the I want it all.. all the food was amazing but personally some stood out more than others, tip pick for me was 24k carrot was light and vibrant, chicken of the sea is a must have !

This place is the coziest hidden gem in a lesser nice part of the city. It has an old classy pub feel and the food matches the vibe. As a person who eats out a lot, I was surprised by how unique the combinations of food was and how I ve never tried a handful of these local ingredients. The chicken of the sea had the yummiest brioche I ve ever had (crunchy and buttery), along with the rich pate, which is balanced by pickled veggies. It really starts your meal with a bunch of flavour. I ve never had Uni in a pate form but the flavour came out nicely. Another highlight was the pork cheeks. Meat was cooked to fall off the bone, tender to touch and it was definitely the star of the show with sauces and fruit to enhance it. These are two dishes you must try! I will say the spices paired with the gourd and the sunchoked pasta are dishes that you may need to acquire a taste for and pronanly have never tried. They re different in a good way but not for everyone. Overall, great food, presentation was equally as good as service and this is a place worth checking out. I came for Dineout, but you can try their tasting menu or even order a la carte. Their cocktails are also delicious and worth a try!

One of the best dinners I ve ever had! These aren t chefs, they are magicians!! The staff was so sweet and friendly, we loved the whole experience and vibe. We got the Two of Us, but my boyfriend was allergic to seafood so they replaced some of the dishes. All of the food made us involuntarily go,  MMM! The Showstopper salad with housemade ricotta had the best ricotta I ve ever tasted. The pasta with duck confit had an explosion of flavour with each bite. The mezzaluna was our first time trying rutabaga, and we loved the bitter earthiness. The full belly was lamb belly stuffed with pork, and I m pretty sure was laced with some sort of black magic because it tasted supernatural. The eclair was light and slightly sweet, with beautiful tart strawberries and rhubarb. The wallflower was our favourite cocktail! Honestly, this place is a good time, and an amazing experience. We ended up paying $230 after all the food and drinks and tip. A bit steep, but SO worth it for a birthday/special occasion, or if you re just tryna treat yo self

Been multiple times and it s always great! Staff is super friendly and the food and vibes are so well curated. We did the tasting menu for my birthday and felt super spoiled. They even wrote us a birthday card that was on the table when we arrived. It s a small spot but totally worth a visit, especially for a special occasion!

Awesome food & lovely service. The staff is super helpful & knowledgeable so don t be shy about asking for their recommendations! The food is super flavourful and good sized portions. Definitely want to do the  try it all  option with a group sometime! Cocktails are strong & unique concepts.

this place was so good. service was great! they held our table even though we were about 20 min late. little squishy as i felt like our neighbor diners could hear everything we said and vice versa but i don t expect anything less when they re trying to fit as many tables in for amazing food. got the tasting menu literally drooling as i m writing this.
Excellent food and service! Only downside is that the room is a bit loud so we had trouble holding a conversation but it was well worth it.

We went for a date night and were so blown away by the food and service.  The menu was playful and creative and the food was executed perfectly.  The chicken of the sea is so clever and delicious, I see why it s their most popular dish.  We also got the maitake mushroom dish, the trout and the bison - all were delicious.  The trout was silky and dreamy.  The wine pairings were on point and every single server was knowledgeable and warm.  The only downsides for us were the neighborhood - it wasn t as bustling as I hoped so we didn t walk around like we had planned, and it was a little crowded inside, although that did lend to the vibrant atmosphere inside.  Overall, a super special place that I d love to visit again.
Beautiful presentation and excellent chefs for I Want It All sampler dinner.
At first, I hesitated to try this restaurant because of the area that is located. But the experience turns out great, we had party of 6 and we tried a every dish on the menu :)

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary and the food and service were amazing. Food was top notch and very very delicious. I could tell the chefs had made it with care. Our server was super lovely and very helpful with the menu. Such a wonderful experience! Cant wait to visit again to try more food. Thank you!

Creative food. I loved the chicken of the sea. Most amazing dish. Very good service. Unique design. Friendly and cozy atmosphere. We went with the a la card  menu instead of the tasting menu. The bison steak was tender and well prepared. Only the desert was not up to the very high standard of the rest of the food. Definitely will go again.

By far the best culinary experience I ve had in my life. Take the table for 2 with the drinks pairing. Also don t be shy to order dishes that are not from the a la carte menue. We had the squid linguine and it was to die for. I want to thank Hana and Patrick as well as the other staff for an awesome experience. Will be telling people from Ottawa to make the pilgrimage to this restaurant (which is what I did Lol)

The people, food and ambiance! Absolutely phenomenal. It was my first time there with my partner and it is now our favourite restaurant in Vancouver! We had the  Just for two special . It was true culinary pleasure. Ps: the trout is incredible. Pss: lamb tartar, just do it.
great and attentive service, tasty drinks, amazing food - so happy that i was finally able to try this restaurant! will definitely be back for more, highly recommend doing the tasting menu experience

Great time visiting for our anniversary, the staff were all knowledgeable about each dish and worked together to seve and provide an amazing experience. Never had squid ink but loved everything we had!! Dont be afraid to step outside your comfort zone

Found my favourite restaurant in the city No more need to be said Would definitely recommend the tasting menu! Expect to be blown away by every dish, fair price, top notch service Only thing we didn t quite like was the dessert (big baba) which we found to be too sweet but that s just Asian tastebuds

Outstanding meal. We went for the tasting menu for my wife s birthday, was perfectly put together. Service was excellent. Special shout out to our Scottish waiter, who was knowledgeable, efficient and had solid banter. A big thank you all.
Loved this restaurant, went for date night and all the food was good. Showstopper Salad really surprised us. Pretty plating and creative food pairings. Drinks could be better but very worth a visit!

Incredible meal! An absolute must do in Vancouver. Unlike any restaurant experience Ive had. The Chicken of the Sea is one of the most amazing dishes Ive had. We had the tasting menu for two but if you have four I recommend the full tasting menu. The drink menu is extensive as well. I would recommend Uber here rather than walking. The neighborhood is not so great and could be shocking if you arent used to a lot of homeless folks, but honestly do not let that deter you. Itll be one of the best experiences youve had. Cant wait to come back.

WHAT A GREAT PLACE Went here a month ago.  One of the very best dinners we had in Vancouver (and in general).  Delicious food (wish I had taken more pictures than just the wonderful desert).  The food was creative and interesting without being snobby or unapproachable.  The staff was super friendly, knowledgeable and enthusiastic.  The wine and cider list was extraordinary with unique and delicious options.  And the setting is warm, homey and lively.  Only strange thing is the park across the street which serves as a main homeless camping site.  What a troubling contrast - shared problems in US and Canada.

Amazing food and service! The food was perfect. The chicken of the sea is a great intro to Uni, and Le Big Mack is genuinely the best desert Ive ever had.  (Also the Halibut was perfectly executed). The service was great, and everyone who brought food to the tables had in depth knowledge of each dish. Really amazing!

I can t believe it s taken me this long to get here. This is easily one of the best tables to sit at in Vancouver.  The food was absolutely delicious.  Everything we had was unique and so tasty.  The service was amazing.  Drink list was great as well.  Make sure to get the I want it all. Amazing value.  I can t wait to go back!

Went here for my birthday. Atmosphere & service were excellent- staff extremely attentive and friendly. Food was incredible and exceeded our expectations. Had the 5 person tasting menu and it was fantastic- each dish presented with unique and complex flavours that worked well together. Only let down was that dessert was a bit lacklustre relative to rest of the menu. Highlight was the halibut.

Hip restaurant in a dodgy part of Vancouver. Great service, amazing food creatively prepared and served. Super reasonably priced. My wife and I had the chefs tasting menu where we got 3 small plates, 2 large plates, and dessert. What a deal! Cocktails are also delish and creatively prepared. Highly recommended.

If you are in a group of four do try the  I want it all  which was $66 per person. You will get every single item on the menu and share it family style. Just like family we fought over every bite because it was incredible. The chicken of the sea pate was a stand-out dish along with the rockfish and the salad. Also, the cocktails here are amazing! Try the strawberry fields cocktail.

Amazing food. Unique flavours you cant get anywhere else. Really friendly service.  Lovely, cozy environment. I recommend getting the feast to share so you can try more things. Cocktails are well balanced and boozy, which I love! Wallflower and Paper Plank are awesome!

Went here with a group of friends and we wanted to try everything on their menu . they have a special called  i want it all  for 66$ that lets you try every single dish on their seasonal menu. their greens are crisp and fresh, and the meats are perfectly seasoned and flavored. We all were stuffed at the end of our meal but in the best way possible. this place is in a pretty sketchy location of town, across from a park that has a lot of homeless people, but the food more than makes up for the location. definitely want to come back when the menu changes to see what else they can do!

Delicious set menu that had great wines to pair with that were all from BC (changed since to include wines around the world). Not great lighting for photos once past daylight. Well created menu and you will not leave hungry. Looking forward to updating this post with more of the ever changing menu.

Wow!!!! Exceeded expectations in every way. Food was 5*, service was above that if there is such a thing, ambiance was perfect. I sat at the bar, dont miss out on the Showstopper Salad (best Ive ever had), Chicken of the Sea dish was soo good, and the Duck!!! Omg...
We want for Valentine s Day. Very nice setting, had the set menu with wine pairings, everything was delicious. Cocktails were great too!
Top notch chef prepared foods. Highly recommend.

A beautiful restaurant offering a high end, gastronomic experience. Truly a foodie spot that decries exemplary and unique fare. Great bartender Matthew guided our 5 course adventure in a warm and charming atmosphere. Great service, beautiful aesthetics, divine grub, sea urchin pate for the win.

The food here is so good! If you have 4 people you can pay $63/person to try everything on the menu. We didnt go with that option and ordered a few dishes to share instead. My top favorites are the uni dish and the salad. The uni was soooo creamy and the squid ink bread was unique and paired well with it. It tasted like I was having fois gras. The cheese that came with the salad was creamy as well and reminded us of boursin cheese. The cocktails were great and the servers were friendly. We felt very safe covid wise and would come back again. If planning to go make sure you make a reservation well ahead of time as the place gets booked up quite fast!

Incredible experience. We ordered their  I want it all  which was a 12 dishes combo, and their food was amazing~ especially the duck duck   ganoush was 10/10. Staffs are well trained and friendly Highly recommended.
It is unique dining experience in the middle of the rough downtown neighborhood. Very tasty menu has some creativity and nice flavors.

Summary: Very unique thoughtful dishes, great ambience, and amazing service to round out a memorable experience! Checked out Mackenzie Room to celebrate my birthday and was very happy with the decision! We tried the Dine OUt menu and opted to sub the Pork dish for the Sablefish as my partner is Pescatarian. Ambience: 5/5 - Cozy atmosphere with great furnishings - Felt very at home and made for a comfortable environment to enjoy the amazing food - Was a cooler night than usual in Vancouver and it got a bit chilly when patrons entered and left the restaurant. This is being really nitpicky though and I wouldnt say it took away from our experience - Music level was perfect and we didnt find that background noise level was too loud as mentioned in other reviews (it being a Monday evening could have been part of the reason) Service: 5/5 Went in on a Monday evening so it wasnt too busy. We were greeted very warmly and all the staff were very friendly and came across as genuine. All the food came out quickly and our plates were cleared promptly without making us feel rushed whatsoever Food: 5/5 While Im definitely partial to protein-heavy meat dishes, I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed the Sea Urchin (Chicken of the Sea) and Parsnip (Wesley Snips) dishes. Each dish was very well balanced, and the flavors were unique. That said, the standout dish for me was the Chicken of the Sea  because everything from the presentation and taste of the brioche bread, all the way to the texture of the hazelnut buttered sea urchin combo were incredibly well crafted. I already want to go back just for this dish! The Salmon (Sir Salmon Rushdie), Sablefish (Surf and Surf), and dessert (Quince of Darkness) were all delicious and the portion sizes were very reasonable too. The next most memorable item for me after the Chicken of the Sea would have to be the Russian Cigarette Paper in the dessert - never had anything like it and it was fantastic! I was on the hungrier side and ended up ordering the Lamb Tartare (Hello Clarice) dish for myself - gotta treat yourself, especially on your birthday right? The dish was fantastic (loved the strong acid flavours that came through). That dish definitely put me over the top, but I had no regrets! Im definitely planning a return visit with some friends to try the I want it All. Drinks: 5/5 My partner opted to try the wine pairings with the Dine Out menu. She was very happy with each pairing, though she did find one of the wines on the sweeter side. She also very much loved one of the South African dryer wines that was served with the Sablefish. I tried the Aggies Manhattan and thought it was very well balanced. It had the perfect amount of flavour while being spirit-forward. Ended up ordering a 2nd one as it was delicious! Overall Rating: 5/5 I had to write a review for our experience at Mackenzie Room as it made for a very memorable and DELICIOUS meal.  Ive been putting off writing my first review, but I HAD to write one for the Mackenzie Room after how great the whole experience was! Vegetarian options: Delicious vegetarian dishes, especially the parsnips! Parking: Street parking out front on Cordova. Not the nicest area

Don t let the generic description fool you - this is a foodie s paradise. You will find a warm, welcoming dining room; friendly and expert staff; and a menu of inventive, well-balanced dishes that demonstrate an expert command of flavors. Cocktails were intentional and paired well. I only wish there were more wine options by the glass. If I lived in Vancouver, I would definitely return, again and again.
Food is great, location is not so good but must try.

Dont get scared away because of the location, this small cozy space with a great atmosphere/vibe and the food is amazing! We had the I want it all, split between 4 people gives you a taste of the whole menu, which I highly recommend! Definitely planning on coming back.
The best meal Ive had in Vancouver. They really managed to take things I dont normally like to eat and make it wonderful. I was truly impressed. Every dish was unique.
Flavours, texture, temperature all well balanced to perfection. Recommend  I want it all  as would be a pity to miss any dishes!

Loved trying the 5 course! Each dish was beautifully presented and encompassed a complexity of flavours. This place is a gem! The 2 downsides are the sketchy location and the limited wine list for glasses (not bottles). If you can get past both youll have an amazing time.

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience dining here. I was amazed with the quality of the food (crazy delicious!!) the execution, the service.. everything! Definitely one of the best restaurants in Vancouver! Apologies on the dark pictures

Delicious food served by people passionate about their food. The I want it all tasting menu at $59pp is available for groups of 2 or more but you get more variety with bigger groups. A standout dish is their uni pate with squid ink loaf!

It really is as good as the reviews. Im assuming the $25 reservation charge is so people do actually come in when they get there. Dont let the neighborhood freak you out, youll definitely regret not eating here. Exceptional. Three of us tried the tasting menu for 3.  Nine of the twelve board options. Doesnt really matter what we had because it sounds like the menu is fairly fluid. There will undoubtedly be items you love and some that will challenge you in one way or another. Really awesome experience.

After a year, visited again, more experienced with dishes and the Mackenzie room is still amount the top place I would like to dine at in Vancouver. The chicken of the sea and the belly of the boar remains my favorite dishes, every time I visit. I would recommend to come with some friends to enjoy the dishes by Sean and have a nice conversation in this 2 hour dinning experience.
Great eclectic small eatery. Constantly changing menu that features a number of choices though choices are limited to that days menu.  Good drinks and wine selection.
They deserve more support during the pandemic! Got the just the two of us tasting menu and it was super tasty and filling. The trout was amazing.

Absolutely wonderful experience at the Mackenzie Room. The low key exterior hides a wonderful gastronomic adventure. Drinks and food were excellent, the servers were knowledgable, friendly and excited to share details of their menu. Menu items had funny names such as Weekend at Bearnaise, Hal 9000, Of Bison Men and my favorite Rhubarbra Streisand! Cocktails were very tasty and imaginative in their ingredients. I certainly will return on my next visit to Vancouver. Mackenzie is a little bit of a walk from most hotels, a taxi can make route finding easier.

Came here on a recommendation of a friend who spent almost 3 hours raving about it as a must try. Had never heard of it and wow was I mistaken. The Chicken of the Sea is sublime and the Duck Duck Ganoush was just out of this world. We opted for the wine pairings and full credit to whomever selected the combinations, they knew the exact combination. Will absolutely love to come back here again!
